text:
I am using Sun's JDK 1.4.0 and I compiled ANT for myself. I set the ANT_HOME
environment variable and ANT worked. Then I copied ant.jar into the extension
dir of the JDK (jre/lib/ext) and now ANT says that it could not find
com.sun.tools.javac.Main. I did not change anything else, I only copied the JAR
archive into the extension directory.
creator: tilman.giese@gmx.de
conor@apache.org
text:
Read the note at the bottom of this section
http://jakarta.apache.org/ant/manual/install.html#installing

Ant is not an extension of the JDK/JRE. It is an application. You really
shouldn't drop much into the lib/ext area unless you know it is an extension. As
such it will not be able to load classes not on the bootclasspath.
